Border Colours

The radius of a border can be changed using the border-radius classes (beginning with bor-rad*) shown below.

Customisation is available to define the border-radius sizes you need for your application, if they are not covered by the default property map.

.bor-rad0
.bor-rad1
.bor-rad2
.bor-rad3
.bor-rad4
.bor-rad5
.bor-rad10
.bor-circle

Usage example

Simply applying a bor-rad* class to any element will give it the corresponding radius. Here's an example of how to use it;

<aside class="bor-1 bor-rad3">
  border has a radius of 3.
</aside>

Media Queries

No media query support for this property. It might not be necessary to supply different values at different breakpoints. Please refer to (the media-query documentation) for more info.

Customising

Default Classes

The default class prefix can be changed by supplying a $border-radius-prop variable.

// change the class prefix to .br-
$border-radius-prop: "br-";

Custom Radii

As with pretty much all of Eezo's properties it's possible to override the default map of properties and values for the border-radius, this is done by supplying a $border-radius map.

// change the border colours to only red and blue.
$border-radius: (
  2: 2px,
  4: 4px,
  8: 8px
);

Combined

After changing the prefix property and the map of radii in the previous two customisations, we would end up with the following css.

/* would result in css like: */
.br-2   { border-radius: 2px; }
.br-4   { border-radius: 4px; }
.br-8   { border-radius: 8px; }

view the source on github: /src/components/border/_color.scss
